lines.gurmukhi: kMcn AsuD jYsy BRmq kuTwrI ibKY suD Bey BRmq n pwvk pRgws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Kanchan Asudh Jaisay Bhramat Koutthaaree Bikhai , Sudh Bhaay Bhramat N Paavak Pragaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As impure gold when heated in a crucible, keep on moving here and there but when purified becomes stable and glitters like fire.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kr kMkn Anyk mY pRgt Duin eykY eyk tyk puin Duin ko ibnws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kar Kankan Anayk Mai Pragat Dhouni , Aykai Ayk Tayk Pouni Dhouni Ko Binaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If many bangles are worn in one arm, they keep making noise by striking with each other but when melted and made into one become quiet and noiseless.

lines.gurmukhi: KuiDAw kY bwlk ibllwq Akulwq Aq AsQn pwn kir shij invws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Khudhiaa Kai Baalak Bilalaat Akulaat Ata , Asadan Paan Kari Sahaji Nivaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a child cries when hungry but becomes quiet and peaceful after suckling milk from his mother's breasts.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy mwieAw BRmq BRmq cqur kuMt DwvY gur aupdys inhcl giiH pd bws hY ]349]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Maaiaa Bhramat Bhramat Chatur Kount Dhaavai , Gur Oupadays Nihachal Grihi Pad Baas Hai ?349?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly a human mind engulfed in worldly attachments and love keeps on wandering all over. But by the sermons of the True Guru, he becomes stable and calm. (349)
